text.name: sys_description
text.text: The Amiga 1200 (A1200) is a computer produced by Commodore released in 1992 as the successor to the Amiga 600/500. It incorporates the substantially more powerful Motorola 68EC020, AGA graphic chipset, 2MB of RAM, sound card, keyboard and disc drive into a singular unit. It is capable of displaying up to 256 colors, boosting up to 262k colors (from a 16m color palette) in HAM-8 mode. It was Commodore's last low-budget model before filing for bankruptcy in 1994. Includes notable titles such as Payback, Guardian, Banshee, Pinball Illusions and various Chaos Engine games.
